Posts.Content:
Mary,
I am so sorry you have to be here but welcome. If it were me I would demand a biopsy. That way you will know for sure 100% that it is nothing. Come back and let everyone know how you are there are some wonderful woman here. Try hard not to worry yourself sick because it really won't help and 80% of all lumps are NOT cancerous. I will keep you in my prayers that you get only the best news. 
Donna
Posts.Title: Second Call back On Mammogram and scared

Posts.Content:
Mary,
I will keep you in my prayers. Hang in there and know that you will be fine. 
Donna
Posts.Title: Second Call back On Mammogram and scared
Aromasin - I'm stopping my last resort.

Posts.Content: Alcie,
Posts.Title: Aromasin - I'm stopping my last resort.

Posts.Content: Alcie,
Posts.Title: Aromasin - I'm stopping my last resort.

Posts.Content: Jane,
Posts.Title: Jane, hope things go well today!

Posts.Content:
susiebuddy,
I pray you get only good news. We are here if you need to talk.
Donna
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump
Chemo - Care Package

Posts.Content:
Lean,
I am so sorry you are having such a hard time. The journey is rough but you can do it. You are now one day closer to this being over. Your not alone. There are a lot of wonderful women here and we all know what you are going through. 
If you try to keep somethig dry in your stomach at all times, just a little bit at a time it does help. Do you have help at home? 
I know what you are saying about
 the hair loss. It was the hardest part for me but when it was gone that was it and I knew it would grow back and it did more beautiful then before. 
Vent all that you want you have every right this sucks and you don't deserve this. I also pray everyday that they find a cure so not one other women will be touched by this disease but until that day you go right ahead and cry if you need to. The shower is the best place for that let the shower wash the tears away and then you can get out and start the day.
You are going to be amazed at just how very strong you are. I very rarely post but I just felt you needed to hear from someone that cares and I do. Sending you a very gentle hug. 
I pray tomorrow will be better for you.
God Bless
Donna
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed with treatments

Posts.Content:
Deb,
Have been reading everyday but not posting. I really could not let this go by. I am so very happy that you have kicked some cancer butt again and may you never have to hear those words again. This is such good news for so many women, I am glad that I went ahead and started the herceptin. It seems to go on forever but forever I will take. I wish you many blessings and only good health. 
Donna
Posts.Title: GOOD NEWS...IT CAN BE BEAT

Posts.Content:
Laure'
Strong is a good place to go. Hearing good things,this is where my friend was doing her consult and was told that our cancer center was doing the standard treatment and that it the same thing they would do if she went up there. I would think the cancer center would also be a good place but have not found out anything out about
 the place. 
If there is anything that I can do to help give me a yell I usally read on here every day. I wish your friend an easy journey and will keep her in my prayers. 
I thought I could not wait to see how the breast looked well I should have waited. It looks gross, I know this will get better with each passing day but for now I'm finding myself crying and in pain and not having a lot of fun. I really do not mean to be cranky so I think I will say good night and God Bless your dear friend.
Love Donna
Posts.Title: Any upstate NY ladies with onco info for my friend?

Posts.Content:
Judy,
Thank you so much for your kind thoughts. Its just for some reason I have been crying a lot maybe I need to give myself time it will just be a week tomorrow. Trying to stop taking the pain meds but I am still getting sharp pain in the nipple. I will be going back to work Tuesday so I will stay busy and should start feeling better. I am meeting with a new friend to celebrate both of our birthdays she is now 49 and I hit the big 50 but thanking God every day for being here to celebrate. Loving everyday with my grandkids.
When were you dx? Are you doing well? I try to keep everyones stories straight but its hard.
Need to go. Take care and stay well.
Donna

AgeInfo.Phrase: our birthdays she is now 49 and I hit the big

Posts.Title: Any upstate NY ladies with onco info for my friend?

Posts.Content:
Laure' 
Tell your friend Barb that I am sorry she has to be looking for this kind of info. I have heard good things about
 Strong, a friend was consulting with them for her treatments and since it was the same that they would do here, she stayed here it was easier. We are about
 2 hours from Rochester. We had taken my father-in-law to highland years ago, but the world of cancer is so much different now then 20 years ago. Where is your friend located? I will see if I can find out anything about
 the Dr. themselves. I will keep your friend in my prayers.
I need to go lay down, I had my right breast reduction done on Mon. I was allergic to something they gave me so I am still covered in a rash.Was sick from what ever it was but feeling better now. Can't wait to see the breast tomorrow when Dr. takes the bandages off. Tired but can't wait. 
Blessings to your friend
Donna
Posts.Title: Any upstate NY ladies with onco info for my friend?

Posts.Content:
Judy,
Thank you for your kind words. I have been having a hard time since surgery I have been crying a lot. I guess I'm just a little down. I head back to work tomorrow that should help. You don't relize how often you brush your breast in a day until it hurts like heck and gets your attention. Healing more everyday. 
Hope you are doing well. How far out from your dx are you?
Think I will head to bed, long day tomorrow.
Stay well!
Donna
Posts.Title: Judy

Posts.Content:
Vicky,
A Muga scan is very easy the hard part is sitting around for a hour after the injection. I am having my 3rd muga scan tomorrow. 
stay well
Donna
Posts.Title: Who Has Done A Muga Scan?

Posts.Content:
Judy,
Thank you so much. I had a very good day, I am back to work and I love my job and am in less pain today. I also went to sign up to be an angel at our cancer center. I think helping someone else is just what I need right now.You are sure right about
 this disease wreaking havoc on us and it always is when we least expect it.
 
I was afraid that I would chicken out so I just jumped in and I'm sure in a month I will be happy that I did it. 
 
How did I do I fluffed up my hair and touched up my makeup and had a much better day. 
You have a lot of courage yourself and thanks for the pep talk. 
Thanks have a good night and stay well
Donna
Posts.Title: Judy

Posts.Content:
Hello,
I hope everyone is doing well. I got an answer back from my insurance company and they will pay to have the other breast reduced to match the side that I had the lumpectomy done on. I'm nervous but excited. I am waiting to hear from the Dr. now to set a date. I will have to stay the night in the hospital which I am finding kind of funny because when I had my lumpectomy they shipped me right out the door. The Dr. siad she can give me better pain meds in the hospital then she could send me home with. Thanks for listening.
Take care.
Donna
Posts.Title: good news

Posts.Content:
Karilyn,
Isn't it strange how life goes on around us when we are still trying to catch our breath. Try to stay busy. I know its hard because we can't turn our minds off. Wednesday will be here soon. I will keep you in my prayers. 
Take care 
Hugs
Donna

Posts.Content:

Blessings to you. Enjoy your good news. Each day is a blessing. Enjoy your family and friends. 
Keeping you in my prayers.

Posts.Content:
Grace,
I will keep you in my prayers.

Posts.Title: bipopy scheduled finally tomorrow

Posts.Content:
harley26,
I am so glad it was not as bad as you were expecting. I am glad that the port is working for you. I did not have a port and even now doing the Herceptin we are just going to keep trying until we can't do any more. I still have 13 treatments to go. Before you know it you will be done. 
How are things with your crohns, is that under control? 
Rest and take care of your self
My best to you.
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
Bernadette,
The Taxol was so much easier for me there was a lot of pain but they gave me something for that. I found if I kept working it was better because I was not going to give into it. I am pig headed I only missed work the day of chemo ( except when I was in the hospital in between my first and second treatment because of my crohns ) I am doing Herceptin, I have 13 to go I will finish up next summer sometime. 
I have had trouble eating meat. I think it is the texture of the meat I could not do it during chemo and almost a year later I still eat very little which is fine with me. I really don't miss it.
The 8 weeks of chemo will fly by. Take care of yourself.
Donna
Carol,
I hope your feeling better as the day goes on.
Take care
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
judy,
That is wonderful news.
stay well

Posts.Title: Mammo Today

Posts.Content:
Ellen,
Don't ever feel like you need to say your sorry for a choice you had to make. All of us need to make decisions that we can live with and know in our hearts we did what each of us needed to do for our own peace of mind. I am so sorry that you ever had to make such a choice. I pray that 2006 will bring some peace of mind. I know how you are feeling worring about
 a reacurrance I am having a really hard time getting past this and I feel like it will always be in the for front of my life. But I get up every day and do what I need to do and try very hard not to let my family see this. Its not my every waking thought but it seems to be there way to often. I will keep you in my prayers and wish you a very wonderful New Year and many new blessings.
Donna
Posts.Title: this past year

Posts.Content:
Judy,
Please don't say your sorry we all have feeling and its hard even when we know that there is someone worse off we still can't help how we feel. This is hard as we all know. When I lost mine I just did not wear mascara so they would not fall out as fast. But in the end they all fell out and so I used a grey color shadow just above on my lid and it did help some. I pray this time will fly by for you.
Donna
Posts.Title: Losing eyelashes again

Posts.Content:
Chantry,
Congrats the hard part is over. I did the Taxol the pain sucked but I still thought it was better then A/C. Your half way there now. I pray the rest of this flys by for you. The rotten part for me was my eyebrows and lashes falling out after my 7th treatment. To look back now I was without they less time that way. 
I will keep you in my prayers. Each day will get better now.
Donna
Posts.Title: No More Red Devil!!

Posts.Content:
Karilyn,
When I was waiting to hear I would just start crying and thought I would never stop, but I did. It felt like I was losing my grip but I didn't and you won't either. I will keep you in my prayers.
Hugs

Posts.Title: 2 cm palpable hard, irregular lump - waiting 2nd mammogram

Posts.Content:
Grace,
What a blessing you just received and in time for the holidays. Now take a deep breath and relax and have a wonderful holiday.

Posts.Title: biopsy report given today

Posts.Content:
Carol,
Sorry you are having such a hard time. I wish I could say something to help. Do you have two more treatments to go?
 I was in the hospital when most of my hair fell out and I felt so bad I didn't care. I feel like it was yesterday sometimes but it has been 18 months since I was dx. I think I was just focused on getting through, that it was over before I knew it. You can do this. Take one day at a time. Rest and drink a lot of water. 
I have also found that it is much harder on my family then on me. I think its because I had a job to do and I did it. 
That is a really good blood count. I had one go as low as .4 boy was I dragging. 
Rest 
You will be in my prayers
Donna
Posts.Title: Carol, are you out there?

Posts.Content:
Happy Halloween!
Hope everyone is doing as well as they can. 
I will be seeing a plastic surgeon on Wed. to see about
 having my good breast reduced to match the other side. Is there anything that I should be asking.
Will they biopsy the tissue that they remove from the breast? I had a core biopsy done on this breast the day I had the lumpectomy done and all was fine. 
Thank you 
Donna
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
stefanie,
I am so happy you got such good news. I love hearing good news. I was also a stage II, 1 of 4 nodes, er+/pr-, her2neu+++. I had blood work today and will get results tomorrow. It is always so hard waiting and I cry every time I get the results. I really hate the wait. 
Treat yourself to something nice tonight. I will keep you in my prayers that you get many more good reports like this one.
Donna
Posts.Title: CA27.29 tumor markers are within normal range!

Posts.Content:
I wish everyone a very blessed Thanksgiving! I have so many wonderful things to be thankful for but none as special as my family and friends. Enjoy your families and friends.
Bless you all
Donna
Posts.Title: Thanksgiving!

Posts.Content:
Gail,
Your Jacob will be in my prayers. I know what you mean about
 a shining light I also have a grandson named Jacob who is 10 for a few more weeks. They are so precious. Let me know how he is doing. There is nothing harder then watching our grandchildren struggle. He is better off where he is for now and he will be home with you before you know it.
I will say a prayer for him.
Stay well
Hugs

Posts.Title: Prayers please!!!

Posts.Content:
Grace,

Posts.Title: HAD THE BIOPSY TODAY AND WAITING

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I'm so sorry that you had to find your way here to this board. You couldn't be in better hands here. 
I had myself so worked up about
 chemo and I found out it was very doable. I never once got sick from the chemo. Found myself very tired but never got sick. Don't get me wrong I didn't feel wonderful but was not what I had feared.
I also have crohns, I was dx with the crohns in Feb. of 04 and the b/c in May of 04. So we were all so happy when 2004 came to an end. If there is any thing I can do to help, just let me know.
God Bless 
Donna
Posts.Title: Newbie to BC, and this board

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I am so sorry you are having such a rough time. I did not get mouth sores but I did get thrush after almost every treatment. 
I remember when I was on the Taxol it hurt if my husband even laid a hand on me. A very hot bath always made me feel better that and a pain med. of course.
There is only so much we can do to avoid the germs but they are every where so just do the best you can do. I work in an Elem. school and was that ever fun trying to stay away from germs. The kids were great and knew I need to be extra careful. I am in a special education classroom and these little sweethearts understood better then some of the adults that I ran across.
It will be over before you know it. I can't believe it has been 14 mos. since my last chemo. Praying you feel better soon.
Take care 
Donna
Posts.Title: Mouth sores, nausea, and YUK!!!!!!! again

Posts.Content:
Hello Susan, so sorry that you have a need to be here but the women are wonderful here. You can find an answer to just about
 any question you could ask. Sorry things have been so rough for you.
Take care
Donna
Posts.Title: Hi Susan (stayinalive)

Posts.Content:
Carol,
Hope this finds you doing well. I am so sorry you are having trouble with your crohns. They say that chemo helps crohns because of the decadron. I had a lot of trouble during chemo. I spent a week in the hospital in between my first and second treatment. Then my seventh treatment was canceled because I had a drainage in my vaginal area. In fact my gyn took care of my crohns during chemo because my gastro was being a pain and did not believe all of the issues that put me in the hospital were due to the chemo. He did not want to see me when both my gyn and my onc spoke to him. So later my gastro and I had a talk and he now listens or knows he is hitting the road. I don't really care if I see him or not, waiting until something better comes along. They say that it is unusal for the crohns not to calm down with the chemo because of the steroids but I always have to do things the hard way. 
As far as the port goes I did not get one at the start of chemo and it did cause a problem being in the hospital and they were using up my veins but then I finished and all was well until I started to do the Herceptin now we are just trying to get through without a port. I started doing the Herceptin 11 mos. after chemo and with the treatments being every three weeks I just want to forget all of it as best I can in between treatments. 
As far as the swelling of your face I do not know for sure but I think it is the steroids I did not have trouble with my face but a friend of mine had trouble the whole time she did chemo.
I hope you do well with further treatments and if I can help in any way just let me know.
Stay well
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
Thank you all for the info, I am calling my ins. company back and asking this question again. I will let you know what they say. 
Best of health to you all.
Donna
Posts.Title: reducing the good breast

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I hope this finds you feeling better. Check in if your up to it. Did you ever find the Mrs. Grass soup? I still eat that soup all the time.
I pray you are feeling so much better.
Donna
Posts.Title: Carol, are you out there?

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I'm glad you are doing well. I also did the neupogen shots it would start on day 3 and I would get them every day for 8 days. The neupogen shot cause pain to the long bones and the Taxol gets the joints. I took the pain meds and it did help. I had my crohns under control until I started my chemo and then I had a couple stays in the hospital and one treatment delayed for a week. But the time really did go fast doing the dose dedense. The first part flew by because I was in the hospital the weeks in between the 1st ans 2nd treatment and only got out in time to do another treatment. Then when I went on taxol I could fuction better. I never missed work from chemo only the day of. The weeks in between were not from the chemo. It is all doable and before you know it you will be done and able to move on. I pray things calm down and your body adjust and the rest of your chemo flies by.
I will keep you in my prayers. ( sorry I did not mean to go on. )
Donna
Posts.Title: Carol, are you out there?

Posts.Content:
MK and Lori,
Thank you for the well wishes. I'm a little nervous and was just wondering. It not set in stone yet I'm just checking it all out. There is a big difference in size and I would be more comfortable with it done but it won't be the end of the world if does not work out. 
The plastic surgeon that I will be seeing is a woman and I like the idea of that. After being felt up by almost every male Dr. in our town when I was dx it will be nice to have a woman. She says that she enjoys this out of all that she does. I'm not looking for perfect just enough to make me more comfortable.
I'll let you know how it goes.
Thank you
Donna
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
Hello,
I got the results from my blood work and every thing was as it should be. This is such a relief. This is so hard every three months. 
I hope every one is doing well. I still have this darn cold and can barely talk. Not that my husband thinks that is so bad.
Thank you all.
Donna
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
Bernadette,
Do you mean the blood work, if it is yes you will, I see my onc. every 3 months and he does blood work and checks for tumor markers. Its hard waiting until you hear back but they are really good and call as soon as they get them. Are you finding the Taxol easier, I had a lot of bone pain but no nausea at all. 
I hurt all over with this darn cold it seems like it will go on for ever. This past week at work was so hard I fell a sleep really early every night. Its the darn cough that is getting me as far as my voice I don't mind not talking to much. Now I think my 7 year old grandson Kyle is catching it. We are a really close family though and so I see the grandkids every day. That was really a God send when I was doing chemo. If I was laying down and resting they would climb up and cuddle with me. Both of my daughters live with in walking distance. My oldest grandson drew our Christmas cards for this year and they have pink ribbons on it. 
Stay well and keep going it makes it easier to get through all of this.
God Bless
Donna

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> Now I think my 7 year old grandson Kyle is

Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
As careful as I was it was not enough I lost all of my brows and my lashes. My eye lashes never fell out until after my 7th Taxol treatment. I just did not think that was fair. My eyes just don't look good until the mascara goes on so that was very hard for me. No one would even know all that had happened if they didn't know me. 
Take care 
Donna
Posts.Title: Losing eyelashes again

Posts.Content:
Bernadette,
I know it stinks having go every 3 months but I am really glad I do. It helps me from getting hyper over everything. 
My cold is refusing to go away, I still can't talk very well and I am still coughing but the cough has changed and it feels like I need to cough something up but it just won't happen. I am starting to get a little cranky. 
I'm sorry I sometimes forget as I brag on about
 my wonderful grankids that thier are people out there longing to have some. 
Its good that you can go to bed early if you need to. Rest as much as you can. Soak in a hot tub, I was doing that all the time. It always felt so good. In fact its not sounding to bad right now.
I think I am going to go get ready for bed the days feel like they are so long right now at work with this cold.
Rest and take care of yourself.
Donna
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
Karilyn,
So sorry you find a need to be here but you couldn't be in better hands. Some very wonderful women here.
I will say a prayer for a b9 result.
Hugs
Donna
Posts.Title: 2 cm palpable hard, irregular lump - waiting 2nd mammogram

Posts.Content:
Kathy,
I had a lot of trouble when I was doing chemo. I never thought much of it until I relized that I did not have any nasal hair left and so my nose ran all the time. Down the back of my throat and out my nose. Since my hair has grown back in the prblem has just about
 gone.
Hope you feel better real soon.
Donna
Posts.Title: What is this?

Posts.Content:
Ellen,
I have been having this problem ,I was told to take vitamin E in the past and it worked like a charm. Give it a try the thing I like about
 trying this again is that its over the counter and I don;'t need to worry about
 my other meds. Hope this helps.They say bananas do help but I think I was told you can't eat enough of them if its because of your potassium.
Take care.
Donna
Posts.Title: didn't someone have limb cramps...OW!

Posts.Content:
Carol,
 I'm sorry your not feeling to well today. What day did you have your treatment? I never got sick from the chemo, I was just sick those two times that I went in the hospital. I lost 16 pounds during the a/c but was hungry on the taxol. A dear friend told me to make sure the first few days to never let my stomach get empty. I would nibble on crackers and bread or snowflake rolls they were so good. This really did work. My husband always made me mashed potatoes and they always helped. I just never let my stomach get empty. I hope this passes quickly for you. Get lots of rest. Sometimes just laying down felt good even if I did not sleep.
What crohns meds are you on? I take colazal, Bentyl and protonix. 
Take care and rest.
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
Kathy,
I will keep you and your sister in my prayers. All will be well.
Donna
Posts.Title: prayers please........

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I found the Taxol to be so much easier than a/c. I won't lie I did have a lot of pain but hot baths and pain meds helped but I was less tired and just felt so much better. You can do it. It soon will be over. I think of you every day and pray you feel better. If a person can tell from a letter, you sound better then a few days ago. I hope you feel better every day.
I don't know if I asked you or not ( I think I did but the mind does not work like it use to ) what do you take for your crohns? Do you go in to remission? sorry all the questions. Just wondering. 
Take care and God bless
Donna
Posts.Title: Mouth sores, nausea, and YUK!!!!!!! again

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I'm sorry you still feel so rotten. I found the Taxol to be so much easier. Joint pain but I felt so much better that I could deal with the pain. I did a lot of soaking in a very hot tub. I pray it will be easier for you. Tell your onc. how you are feeling they will be able to find something that can help. I'm sorry that you are having to deal with your crohns as if the bc isn't enough on your plate. I wish I could say something that would help. 
I almost forgot the Mrs. Grass soup is in a blue box, there are two hooked together and you break them apart and cook just one. All that is in it is noodles and broth. 
Try and get rest when you can.
Keeping you in my prayers
Donna
Posts.Title: Insomnia again...ARGGGG!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content:
Bernadette,
I also had a lumpectomy and now have two different size breast. I found some sports bras that are made like a regular bra ( not the pull over ones ) and the sports bra just squishs the bigger breast. This has worked very well for me. They even have them in different colors. Not real sexy but it works. 
I am seeing a plastic surgeon early in Nov. to see about
 having the larger breast reduced. 
Wow I can't believe you are done with the a/c it seems like I just read that you were starting. Did you do 4 a/c?I did 4 a/c and 4 taxol. The taxol went well for me alot of joint pain but meds took care of that. I found it to be easier then a/c. I had problems with my crohns with both treatments but the treatments were not as bad as the a/c.
I wish you the best and pray for taxol to be kind to you. 
Donna

Posts.Content:
Carol, 
Thank you for your prayers. I will let you know how it goes. I hope you are feeling better. 
stay well

happy
Thank you for the info. I was hoping they check but you just never know. Are you all finished with reconstruction?
stay well

 15 months from when I had my lumpectomy.

Posts.Title: reducing the good breast

Posts.Content:
Thank you every one for all your good thoughts.
 I saw Plastic surgeon today and it went very well. She said that with all she saw she does not see a problem with my insurance company. It will take 4 to 6 weeks to hear back from the ins. co. and then we can set a date then. I did get to see some pictures I don't want things perfect just more the same size. Hard to but bras with one side to big and the other to small.I just don't want to get my hope up and then have them shot down. So I guess I wait again.
I have not heard back about
 my blood work hopeing in the morning, I hate this waiting and waiting. I get so sick to my stomach. I have a rotten cold that I have been trying for two weeks to get rid of. So I am just a little cranky. 
I forgot to ask the dr. if there is any problem doing this while on Herceptin. Does any one know. 
I am so tired I am going to bed will pop in tomorrow to see if everyone is doing well.
Take care and thank you all.
Stay well
Donna
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon

Posts.Content:
Julie,
I will say a prayer for you. Everything will be fine. I had mine when I was 32. Remember to take it easy and you will be fine.
Donna
Posts.Title: Total Hysterectomy on Monday

Posts.Content:
Hope everyone is doing well. 
I am doing Herceptin every three weeks and I do not know if this has anything to do with it but I have been getting awful cramping in the calves of my legs. They hurt so bad they wake me up. I was just wondering if could have anything to do with the Herceptin.
My best to you all.
Donna
Posts.Title: leg cramps

Posts.Content:
Deb,
I am so sorry that you are having trouble. I will keep you in my prayers. Rest . All will be well.
Donna
Posts.Title: Prayers Needed

Posts.Content:
DonnaA
Hope your feeling well. When I did my rads they had me use a powder called soothe & cool( has cornstarch in it ) I just went in to the bathroom as often as I could and spinkled some all over the breast. they said it was important to keep the breast dry and that was what the powder was for. It worked very well and I only used lotion at the very end when I got the dry feeling like you get after you have had a sunburn, even though I did not burn. My best to you. Its almost over. 
Donna
Posts.Title: Radiation

Posts.Content: Hope everyone is doing well.
Posts.Title: Effexor

Posts.Content:
Carol,
Whine all you want it sucks when this happens because we really need the sleep. They told me that it was the Decadron causing the problem. It would let up for me before the next treatment. You proably don't want to hear that this to will pass. I'm sorry you are having a bad time. Keeping you in my prayers.
Donna
Posts.Title: Insomnia again...ARGGGG!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content:

 every where I go now.

Posts.Title: Pink Ribbon Time!

Posts.Content:
Vicky,
Saying a prayer that you only hear good news.

Posts.Title: CT Results Today

Posts.Content:

It has been almost a year since I had my last chemo. I still get the numbness and the pain in my fingers and toes but am noticing that the space between times when it acts up is getting longer. So I hope the end of that will be soon. I hope you will soon see it letting up. My best to you.

Posts.Title: numbness in fingers and toes

prayers to you

Posts.Title: Need some extra prayers from my breast buddies

Posts.Content:
Laure'
Getting a little confused, what do you take just for the calcium or is it all of that? Please tell me its not all of it. With the crohn's and other things I take 22 pills a day and the thought of taking more gags me. I have been having a really hard time getting them all down latley. So I have to confess I take nothing for the old bones. So if you have a very small pill let me know. 
Thanks
Donna
Posts.Title: Omega3 gel caps from salmon for leg cramps

Posts.Content:
Have any of you on Arimadex noticed weight gain. I have put on all the weight that I lost during chemo. I have not had any problems with the Arimadex other then that. 
Does any one know about
 the Effexor can you take it if you were er+, the hot flashes are driving me crazy. 
Take care

Posts.Title: I start tamoxifan tomorrow

Posts.Content:
I was wondering if anyone has had thier good breast reduced so it would be more equal with the B/C breast and did you have any trouble with your insurance. My insurance company said there has to be a medical reason for it. My good breast is double the size of the other and it bothers me. I wear sports bras and squish the good breast but some days that is very uncomfortable. 
Thanks
Donna
Posts.Title: reducing the good breast

Posts.Content:
Deb,
Sorry things are not any better with your daughter. It sounds like you have your hands full. I don't know about
 you but I think it was easier with kids when I was younger. Now I'm ready for bed long before the kids. I will keep you in my prayers. Drop me a line if you just need to talk.
Donna
Posts.Title: Prayers Needed...Update

Posts.Content:
Carol,
Helps if you reread before you hit submit. When talking about
 my gastro he never believed any of my problems were because of my crohns, not even when I had a drainage in my vaginal area. I'm sure your crohns will settle down with the chemo, I told you I just like to give them a hard time.
my best
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
Carol,
I'm sorry your feeling so bad. Sorry but the bad taste in your mouth will be there for awhile, try gum or suck on hard candy. There was jars of candy sitting out where we did chemo and it did seems to help. Just not a good idea if your laying down. ( sorry I sound like a mother ) 
I nice longggg soak in a really hot tub helps ( check into a hotel that has a jacuzzi, just kidding but I thought about
 it ) with all the aches and pains. Is this part of your crohns or is this new for you? I barely had time to figure out all the junk with the crohns when I was dx with the bc. ( Crohns in Feb. and bc in May )
I was always carrying around dinner rolls and would just keep pulling tiny bites off and putting them in my mouth because 
opening my mouth and trying to take a bite would gag me. Have you ever found Mrs. Grass noodle soup, all it has in it is noodles and broth and that seemed to help if I just sipped on it. In fact I am sipping on the soup now, I have a cold and feel rotten today. 
I know you might not think so right now but this will pass and you will have good days in betweeen treatments just make sure you do a lot of drinking. Water was always best for me, but a lot of people say ginger ale works really well.
I hope you feel better soon and let me know if I can help in any way.
Keeping you in my prayers
Donna
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content:
Michelle,
That is wonderful news. I used powder, made with cornstarch through out the day. I would just go in the bathroom sprinkle some on the breast and I never had a problem. It kept everything dry and that was what they siad they wanted. 
My best to you.
Donna
Posts.Title: B-9 results

Posts.Content:
Deb,
Thank you for the info, my onc. talked with my ins. co. and it should not be a problem. Hope they know what they are talking about
. There is also a program where the drug company is helping out when insurance will not pay. I am glad to hear that the side effects are not to bad. I will be able to get 2 treatments in before I go back to work in Sept. I will be having a Muga scan on Mon. and my first treatment on Tues. I spoke with a girl yesterday who is doing once a week, she finished her chemo at the end of Dec. so she also had a pause like I did. She also spoke with another onc. who felt that doing the Herceptin even though she has been fininshed with chemo for a while was a very good idea. I am for doing every thing that I can to make sure this does not return. This girl I spoke with is only 34 when she was dx. I read that the risk of heart issues is greater if you are doing Herceptin when you also do A/C. So hopefully that will not be an issue for me. 
 The road seems like such a long one sometimes but we do what we need to do. I also have crohns and am hoping that the herceptin and the crohns get along. I'm not seeing a problem though. 
I hope all is going well for you. Take care and thank you very much for your help.
Donna

AgeInfo.Phrase: I spoke with is only 34 when she was dx <Z>

Posts.Title: need some help

Posts.Content:
Deb,
Thank you for the help. I guess if that is the worst I get from the Herceptin I can handle it. It not A/C. I was wondering what brought it on because it was waking me up and boy do they hurt.
I would like the name of what the Dr. gave you to take the edge off. How often did you have Muga scans on the Herceptin. I think he will do another one after my next treatment. He said every three months.
I hope you are doing well and that things are going better with your daughter. I will keep you and your family in my prayers. I have been meaning to e-mail you to see how you were doing but I have been coming home from work so tired. I have an appt. with the plastic surgeon on Nov. 3 to see about
 having my good breast reduced so I hopefully will match up. I spoke with the ins. company again and the story this time was that they would pay. So I guess i'll have the Dr. send something to the Ins. company. Thanks
My best to you.
Donna

 a week and half and I will talk to him about

Skeeter good luck to you going back to work. What do you do? I know I have read it here some where but I don't remember where. I keep saying its chemo brain but my husband says its been to long, but I'm sticking with that.

 2 1/2 weeks ago. It went well although I had a hard time getting back in that chair. I had alot of pain, I felt like I hurt all over like the flu or something. Is this a side effect to the Herceptin?I am due for my next one this Tuesday.

Posts.Title: Microcalcifications - Update

Posts.Content:
Deb,
Thank you so much for the info. They kept saying that there was not any side effects to speak of but I sure was hurting. I was hurting in all the places that the taxol bothered. I still am bothered with the fingers and toes sometimes but each time now does not seem as bad so I really think this is starting to pass. I will have a treatment on Tuesday and then I will have 15 more to go. I am having a harder time going this time then I did when I did my chemo. I was a week off on my 7th treatment really long story. I even tryed to get my onc to do my last treatment a week early, he just laughed. 
It must be so hard to go every week, I met a girl here in town where we live that is doing it weekly she is 32 years old. She has been doing well. She finished her treatment in Dec. so she is doing this like I am with a long pause after chemo. My onc. said that there were no studys with Herceptin doing it so long after chemo but he did feel it could not hurt to try. This girl I spoke with even got a second oppion from another onc. She said to grab it if she could get it. So she did and so did I. I am going to finish this, I guess I just need to grumble alittle while I'm doing it. 
I may take you up on the e-mail if you don't mind.
Stay strong
Donna

AgeInfo.Phrase: doing it weekly she is 32 years old <Z> <Z> <Z>

Posts.Content:
Hello to all, I hope this finds everyone doing well. I have a question, if you have chemo first and then surgery and they remove nodes and they are negative. Were they negative before or did the chemo clean them up? If you don't know if they were or not before surgery how does that put you at less of a risk? I keep reading and I see they are doing more of that now but it does not make sense to me. I was just wondering. 
I read everyday and would like to say hello to all of the new girls. You have found a good place to be.
Thanks Donna

 So very sorry that you have to be here. You should be able to get an answer to just about

Posts.Title: Effexor

Posts.Content:
Hope everyone is doing well. I finished chemo the end of last Sept. and rads the middle of Dec. I was a stage 2 w/ 1 node involved.I was her2nu +++ and hormone + . I do take armidex. I was not able to get into the trial for the herceptin. I saw my onc. today for a 3 month check and we spoke alot about
 the herceptin. He said that in the study there was 45% fewer reacurences. My onc. said that even though there have been no studys with herceptin after this length of time that he would not have a problem with giving it to me for a year ( providing my insurance would pay)I was wondering what all of you thought, I guess I feel that I would be doing everything I could to prevent a reacurence. Can anyone tell your experience with herceptin. ( Am I out of my head? )
Thank you 
Donna
Posts.Title: need some help

Posts.Content:
Janis,
You will be done with rads before you know it. I have been taking Armidex for 8 months now and I really have not noticed any side affects. I also have crohns and take a lot of meds for that and it is sometimes hard mixing all these drugs but the only thing I had trouble with was nausea and I started taking it at night before bed and that took care of that problem. I wish you well with your rads and hope all goes well for you on the Armidex.
Donna
Posts.Title: Just started rads with week

Posts.Content:
Heidi,
I agree with Julie. I was told in Dec. (2004)that my ultra sound was negative to be told in May (2004) that I had breast cancer. You should ask for a biopsy so that everyone can be 100% sure. I am not trying to scare you but 
its better to be sure.
I pray all turns out well and that in the end it is B9.
Donna

Posts.Title: Mammogram all clear

Posts.Content:
Can anyone tell me a little about herceptin, is it a chemo drug or what? I read that it can be taken weekly, if its chemo do you get all the side effects like chemo? I read the article that mnlady 13 posted and wondered about this. I aiso was her-2 positive. I know it is called a targeted therapy. Is it taken with chemo, or after ? It is uncomfortable reading this but when I was doing my chemo last June to Sept. they only did herceptin with advanced stages of bc. Just trying to understand this. Thank you.
grammy
Posts.Title: herceptin

Posts.Content:
Thank you all for the input, I was her2 3+++ which I know is not good my Dr. treated me with an aggressive chemo and I pray that was enough but if there is more that I should have done or could be doing, I want to know.
wouldn't you know I just had a three month check and all was clear so now if I want to talk to him I will have to call for another appt. I see my rads. Dr. in the early part of June but she would say see your onc. By the way how often do all of you see your onc. for three months, before it goes to 6 months?
I have to go my little two year old date is here.
Thanks for all the help. 
Grammy

AgeInfo.Phrase: the input  I was her2 3    which I know is not

Posts.Title: herceptin

Posts.Content:
Thank you all for the advice, how do I ever stop the worring my husband is getting upset with me and I know I need to move on but how. Any ideas? 
Michelle,
 I did dose dense AC and Taxol and then rads. I hope you are doing well with your treatment. I pray it goes easy for you. I would not have had such a bad time but was in the hospital twice and had 1 taxol treatment delayed because of my crohns.
Lori and Deb,
I know in my head that you are both right about not looking back but , sorry I always seem to throw the but in there. My husband says to get on with life and I thought thats what I had been doing. I worked through my chemo. My rads Dr. always tells me to know that I did all that I could do to see that it would not come back. Now I really want to add but what if. But I won't. My Onc. said the same about how often he would see me, I wonder if it was the same for everyone. He also said I could stay at 3 months if that made me more comfortable. 
I have been making breast cancer bracelets, and I really find it helps I have sold almost 40 of them and everyone just loves them. I find some peace from it and have donated some of the money to help with breast cancer. I have given some as gifts to a few ladies that I know that just finished their treatments. One of the girls is my sister-in-law who found out right after I finished my rads. She is doing well and hers was found very early and that was a blessing. Thank you all for listening and for the good advice. I'm keeping the faith, every now and then I flip out and I guess this was that time. 
Thank you all
grammy
Posts.Title: herceptin

Posts.Content:
Stef,
Thank you for all the info on the herceptin. I have been finished with chemo for 8 months, I have been reading all about how they are using Herceptin now and I was wondering if it could be used now but it really sounds like the time would have been after my chemo. It was just an idea, trying to make sure I covered all my bases. My onc. tryed to get me into a clinical trail but they would not take me because I did not have enough nodes removed. In the end it was for the best with the crohns. Thank you so much for the help. Everyone has been so kind.
Donna
Posts.Title: herceptin

Posts.Content:
Candy,
Thank you for sharing your sisters story it was very moving, myself and my daughters and two of my grandkids will be doing one this Sunday. It is so sad that breast cancer had to touch my life before I opened my eyes and see how very many lives this disease has touched. This past year was very hard, but some very wonderful people have touched my life and will never be forgotten. It will be a year tomorrow since my dx. I am happy and scared, it still is so strange to think that I am a cancer survivor. 
Donna
Posts.Title: Race for the Cure - Cols. OH May 14, 2005

Posts.Content:
Vicki,
I am so sorry you are going through this. I will keep you in my prayers that all goes well on Tuesday.

Posts.Title: Found a New Node, CT Scheduled

Posts.Content:
Lori and Deb,
Thank you so much for the pep talk, my husband and I have been having a really hard time. In the beginning I told my husband that he couldn't cry with me, because I would not have been able to hold it together if he cryed in front of me. So he kept it together and I could not have done it without him. The poor guy on the off week from chemo I was in the hospital because of my crohns and would come out in time to have my next treatment. So we are trying to talk about all of this now. I do take zoloft and it does help but I never started taking it until I finished with rads. My kick butt mode was over and I started to fall a part. I have good days and bad days. I have four wonderful grandbabies, they melt my heart with just a smile. 
I am going to hop up to the top and see if I can get to know the two of you. I hope and pray you all are doing well.
grammy
Posts.Title: herceptin

Posts.Content:
Candy and Lori,
Thank you so much for thinking of me today. I was so very busy at work today that I really did not have a chance to think about
 it until now. My family cares and understands but I think you need to have traveled the journey to really understand. I will celerate them one by one and smile by smile. Having HAD bc has brought so many very wonderful people into my life.
Thank you again
donna
Posts.Title: Congratulations Grammy

Posts.Content:
MK and Deb,
Thank you so much for thinking of me. 
My daughters and mother-in-law and two of my granchildren and my self went to a walk-run ( of couse we did the walk )today for bc. It was so nice to be ther with part of my family. They were all such a big part of my support team, could not have done it without them. I hope this finds you all doing well and enjoying the rest of your day.
Donna
Posts.Title: Congratulations Grammy

Posts.Content:
Mia,
I am so glad for you. It feels good when it is over. When I was finishing up chemo I kept saying I felt like a kid at Christmas, so the day I finished my family gave my Christmas gifts, my oldest daughter even found Christmas paper to wrap my gift in. I have a very wonderful family. Wishing you only the very best of health.
Donna
Posts.Title: I'm a GRADUATE, got my diploma in the mail!

Posts.Content:
Hello and I hope this finds everyone feeling well. I'm sorry I feel like I only come here when I need help but I read everyday. 
We took my mother to the breast clinic in Rochester, New York to rule out inflamatory breast cancer, I was still very uncomfortable when we left. Before going she had a red spot on the left breast and that breast leaks, also her nipple is now inverted and she gets alot of pain in the breast. They tryed her on an antibiotic and the redness went away but everything else remains and they can now feel a lump so at the clinic they did a repeat mamo and U/S and a needle biopsy which came back neg. and they told her that they saw a cluster of cyst and that was where they took the biopsy from.All that I have read says that they don't rule out inflamatory b/c with a needle biopsy. I read something about a skin punch biopsy. I think my mom would like to just go with the neg. biopsy and be done with it. I would welcome any advice that anyone could share. 
I find all of this unsettling, its time for my 3 month check on May 3rd and I'm anxious about that . I feel like some days I see a normal person in the mirror and other days I'm not so sure. Thank you for listening.
grammy
Posts.Title: Need some help!

Posts.Content:
michele,
thank you so much for your response. the nipple retration is a new thing. My mother saw her gyn today and he does not think she needs to go any futher with this. the hard part here is that she just wants to go with what he is telling her. I know where she is coming from on that but, if it is IBC waiting 4 months to have a recheck could be 4 months to long. I was told in Dec. of last year that the lump that they could see on the u/s was nothing to be told in May that I had B/C. I guess it is her choice, but it is making me worry and its now time for my 3 month check and I worry about that. So pretty much all I do is worry. 
Thank you so much for listening and the good advice I'm just not sure what I can get her to do with it. I shall keep trying. 
God Bless
Grammy
Posts.Title: Need some help!

Posts.Content:
This may sound really stupid but I guess what I am trying to ask is, do they give herceptin after you have done chemo to help stop the cancer from coming back? or does this only work right after your treatment?
thanks,grammy

Posts.Content:

Everyday is not wrapped around bc but it is there everyday. I thank you so much this has been such a help because I was wondering if I was the one that was stepping over the edge. I' glad these are all normal feelings. well at least for this anyway. 
So how are things with you, do you still take the Tamoxifen. I live in Pa. Two beautiful daughters and four grandbabies and I have been married for almost 33 yrs. I turned 49 a few months ago.
Prayers for good days for you.

Posts.Title: Need some help!

Posts.Content:
MK,
You said your mammo was a more compressed picture, I asume you have already had it done. I pray all went well. We will be taking my mother on the 15th for another mammo and ultra sound, at a clinic that only does this. My oldest daughter has been to this clinic and said it was very nice. The Dr. said that this is only 1 to 2 % of breast cancers. That is a scarey thought. I have to get going, I have to work tommorrow and 5:30 comes early. Oh I almost forgot I saw my rads Dr. today and she says that all is well everything that I am feeling is normal, you have to love that word. God bless and take care.
my best

Posts.Title: Diagnostic mammo

Posts.Content:
Deb,
I want to just run to the onc but I know I can't do that all the time. Some days are better then others.
My mother wants to wait, I Guess I need to let her run the show, she is an adult like I just told my mother-in-law about myself. So for now I'll wait.
We have four grandbabies but we have three boys and one girl. Jacob is 10, Kyle is 7, Hannah is 5 and Nicholas is 22mos. These babies are what helped me to get through the past 10 months. 
Thanks for the hugs
Best of health to you
Grammy
Posts.Title: need some help,please

Posts.Content:
First I want to tell MK that I will say a prayer for good news on your mammo. Can anyone tell me the difference between a diagnostic mammo and a regular one? We will be taking my mother to a breast clinic in Rochester N.Y. next week. I think her Dr. is getting concerned now. He can now feel a lump. So they are trying to rule out inflamatory breast cancer. From everything I have read it sounds like all of my mothers symptoms. I will pray that it has just been an infection. I don't know if I can face all of this I'm only 11 months out from DX. It feels like it was yesterday. If anyone knows anything about this type of cancer I would like to hear from you.
Good Health to you all
grammy
Posts.Title: Diagnostic mammo

Posts.Content:
I don't post often but read almost every day. I am just 10 months out from my DX. I had a lumpectomy and did A/C and Taxol and then rads. My mother just had a mamo and u/s on this past Monday. Her left breast has been leaking and recently she noticed a red area. The mamo report showed nothing, but the u/c report says that there is a dilated duct and that it displays internal echoes. Also says that it is not readily classifiable as benign or malignant. Says it is most suggestive of infection/ mastitis, but the possibility of inflammatory carcinoma cannot be excluded. Extremely close clinical followup is strongly recommended. The Doctor put her on an antibiotic for a week and if the redness goes away they will do a repeat of the u/s and if the duct is no longer dilated it was an infection but if there is still something showing there would be futher testing. My head is spinning with all of this I feel like I have barely gotten back on my feet. I was d/x with crohns a year ago Feb. and then the bc in May. I feel like everything keeps crashing in on me. Does this sound like this is something to worry about or not? My Mom said that some of the redness is better since taking the antibiotic. I'm sorry to go on but, I feel like my head and heart have had a work out this past year. 
Thanks for listening
grammy
Posts.Title: need some help,please

Posts.Content:
Thank you all for your very kind words and prayers.I have been busy and have not been around much and we went out of town last weekend, first time I have been able to get on and read how everyone is doing. They added another few days of the anti-biotic for my mother. The redness is gone but she is still having a lot of pain in the breast. I don't know that I am comfortable with the Doctor waiting until April 4 to repeat the US. What do you guys think.? MK my mother is 70 and I just turned 49. I have 4 of the sweetest grandbabies.The very light of my life.
Quick question for myself, my breast is still very sore and its hard to tell if everything I feel is just from the rads. I don't want to be whining and running to the Dr. every time I turn around. I don't know how I will ever get use to this constant worring. I want to thank you all for the advice and prayers. 
Best of health to you all
grammy

AgeInfo.Phrase: think   MK my mother is 70 and I just turned 49

Posts.Title: need some help,please

Posts.Content:
Vicky,
I hope you don't mind my butting in, I don't post very often but read everyday. I also took Neupogen shots every two weeks for 4 months. The pain is pretty uncomfortable. I would hurt so bad that my poor husband could not lay a hand on me at night. A hot soak in the tub helped some and I did take pain meds. As with everything else related to chemo this to passed. I'm still having quite a bit of pain, which my onc says is from the Taxol. I pray this passes quickly for you and that it is not to bad. 
My best to you
Donna
Posts.Title: Neupogen Pain

Posts.Content:
Jenny,
I have been reading a lot of your post here nad on the crohns board and wanted to say hello. I will be praying that you get a B-9 with your biopsy. Your story caught my eye because I was dx with crohns last feb. and then with breast cancer in May. I finished chemo the end of Sept. and Rads in Dec. I still worry everyday.I don't know how to get on with my life. I am trying to fight my way back to doing things I once enjoyed. I know the fear, and odd thoughts such as will I be here in the summer, will I see my grandkids grow up? I am so sorry for all that you have been through and wish you the very best and will be saying a lot of prayers for you. Its hard to forget all that has happened this past year but when my grandkids smile and melt my heart, I try very hard to live in today and not tomorrow. I wish you the very best and will keep saying a prayer for you and your family.
grammy
Posts.Title: Hello Nature's spirit

Posts.Content:
Jessie,
 I don't know what test you are having but I pray that everthing is ok.
Love grammy
Posts.Title: Get this one ER/PR negative girls!
